result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Robert Dollar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Eric Robert Dollar in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments. 

Count 1:

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

38 MONTH(S) IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  14 MONTH(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  24 MONTHS(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
*Obtain a valid driver's license if deemed appropriate by the Agent.

Apply cash bail to warrant on Case 12FA869

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (Apply remainder of cash bail);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (Apply cash bail - Balance to be paid as condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

CONDITION TIME: (Apply 48 Days Credit) 60 Days Huber with release for work and/or treatment, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2018 at 08:45 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric Robert Dollar in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts plea colloquy.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 3, and 4 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Weitzner requests another date for sentencing.  Court grants.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2018 at 08:45 am.
